result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Defendant Nolan R Boomsma in court.  Prosecuting attorney Will R Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicated he is going to go to SPD and apply today.  He was also given information regarding court appointed atty and private counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MAB or Melissa S. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Summit or Capitol One location. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

09:10 AM Defendant appeared.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
